pull.title: Do not block GUI thread in RPCConsole
pull.body:
Ported from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17659.

On master (b4d0366b47dd9b8fe29cc9a100dcdf6ca1d3cabf) the GUI thread is blocked with [`QThread::wait()`](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qthread.html#wait) during `bitcoin-qt` shutdown routine. This causes unresponsive GUI if some commands are passed to the RPC console (#53) before shutdown initiating.

This PR:
- removes blocking call and uses additional signal-to-slot connections.
- makes `bitcoin-qt` shutdown routine more streamlined: the only [`QApplication::exec()`](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qapplication.html#exec) is used in `bitcoin-qt`. Therefore, the main event loop never interrupts until shutdown.

Fix #53

repo.name: gui
repo.description: Bitcoin Core GUI staging repository. Please do not fork unless for development reasons.

events.body: Rebased 47912c505eebc79c849cf14fcf9d2654caa0945a -> 5549c453b1817084dd9b5f463ecd4d8277b973e8 ([pr59.01](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr59.01) -> [pr59.02](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr59.02)) due to the conflict with #35.

Tested this a bit.
* I can't shutdown with this PR when I call `gettxoutsetinfo` in the RPC console
* Calling `generate(1000, getnewaddress())` still blocks the GUI thread

What I'd like to see is:
* Keep the RPC console synchronous "single channeled". If I call `gettxoutsetinfo`, regardless of the non-blocking GUI mode, it should **not** allow to enter a next command before the old has completed.
* Things like "`generate(1000, getnewaddress())`" should not block the GUI and there should be an idle indicator (maybe just the text "executing...") in the RPC console.
Seems like it would be even better to allow multiple RPC executions, and insert the return values in the applicable place :)

> Seems like it would be even better to allow multiple RPC executions, and insert the return values in the applicable place :)

Why? Seems a source of confusion.

@jonasschnelli 
>  - Calling `generate(1000, getnewaddress())` still blocks the GUI thread

I've made some debugging, and now I believe that this is [another](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/issues/122) issue, which is uncorrelated to #53, and it has nothing to do with the `RPCExecutor` thread.

Not sure if #122 should be fixed at all, as it is a pretty edge case, and a possible fix could touch the code at least in three important places.

@jonasschnelli 
> What I'd like to see is:
> 
>  - Keep the RPC console synchronous "single channeled". If I call `gettxoutsetinfo`, regardless of the non-blocking GUI mode, it should **not** allow to enter a next command before the old has completed.
> 
>  - Things like "`generate(1000, getnewaddress())`" should not block the GUI and there should be an idle indicator (maybe just the text "executing...") in the RPC console.

Mind looking into #123 ?

ACK 38efc5a11294ac56a9a098139813b94faf3979e9, Tested on macOS 11.1 with Qt 5.15.2

Confirming that I can replicate the bug described in #53 on master.

Confirming that this PR allows me to shutdown the GUI right after calling `gettxoutsetinfo` both in the `Console Window` and through `bitcoin-cli gettxoutsetinfo` after running the GUI with the `-server` option.

Confirming that I can replicate the issue laid out by @jonasschnelli [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/59#issuecomment-715275185) about `generate`. There is no longer a generate command available in the `Console Window`, instead I replicated with `bitcoin-cli -generate 10000` after running bitcoin-qt with `-server`. But, this bug is meant to be fixed by #123.

events.message: qt: Do not block GUI thread in RPCConsole

events.body: Rebased 38efc5a11294ac56a9a098139813b94faf3979e9 -> 84a9a7ce4ddf6627afca42e6ed6fd8ead55503f9 ([pr59.03](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr59.03) -> [pr59.04](https://github.com/hebasto/gui/commits/pr59.04)) due to the conflicts with #115 and https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21328.

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/issues/53#issuecomment-931322978:

> On the current master ([bd40cd8](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/commit/bd40cd81083a5bde15b90e66855255457c8fb58c)) this bug is no longer reproducible. However, the blocking call `QThread::wait()` is still present in the `RPCConsole::setClientModel` function.
> 
> Tested on Linux Mint 20.2 (Qt 5.12.8) and on Windows 10 Pro 20H2 (MSVC build).
> 
> Closing for now.

Closing.

comments.body: The `trayIconMenu` contains some `QAction` instances. I think we do not need any chance to activate any of them during shutdown.
